title: Hero MotoCorp Q1 Preview: Revenue, Profit seen declining amid volume weakness and EV drag
summary: Hero MotoCorp is expected to post muted Q1FY26 results, with both revenue and profit likely declining YoY due to weak volumes, supply issues, and higher EV mix. Brokerages see limited margin support from price hikes. Management's demand outlook and EV strategy will be key focus areas for investors.
fullContent: Hero MotoCorp is expected to post muted Q1FY26 results, with both revenue and profit likely declining YoY due to weak volumes, supply issues, and higher EV mix. Brokerages see limited margin support from price hikes. Management's demand outlook and EV strategy will be key focus areas for investors.

title: India Playbook 2025: Global equities on a risk-on trade, India struggles to keep pace
summary: Global equity markets have rallied strongly, driven by easing interest rates and improving liquidity. While Indian large-caps have lagged, small-caps are in line with the global risk-on trend. Despite short-term challenges like slowing consumption and high valuations, India's macro stability, FII re
fullContent: Global equity markets have rallied strongly, driven by easing interest rates and improving liquidity. While Indian large-caps have lagged, small-caps are in line with the global risk-on trend. Despite short-term challenges like slowing consumption and high valuations, India's macro stability, FII return, and structural themes offer long-term investment potential.

title: Swiggy vs Eternal: Which stock promises better value delivery post Q1 show?
summary: Eternal, the parent company of Zomato and Blinkit, posted a 55% year-on-year increase in its B2C net order value (NOV) for Q1FY26. Blinkit, its quick commerce division, recorded a 140% YoY growth in gross order value (GOV), surpassing food delivery for the first time and becoming Eternal’s largest b
fullContent: Eternal, the parent company of Zomato and Blinkit, posted a 55% year-on-year increase in its B2C net order value (NOV) for Q1FY26. At current oil prices, production in the shale patch has peaked, Kaes Van’t Hof wrote in the letter, adding that
fullContent: Diamondback Energy expects a jump in crude oil production globally in the second half of the year, which could lead to a glut, the company’s chief executive said in a letter to investors. At current oil prices, production in the shale patch has peaked, Kaes Van’t Hof wrote in the letter, adding that “the likelihood of a massive oil supply glut combined with an oil demand shock seems to have dissipated (on the demand side)”. title: India strikes back at Trump's 'more tariffs' threat, says US targeting 'unjustified'
summary: India strongly protested against potential US tariffs for importing Russian oil, arguing that it's essential for affordable energy and national interest. The Ministry of External Affairs highlighted that the US and EU are unfairly targeting India while maintaining significant trade ties with Russia
fullContent: India strongly protested against potential US tariffs for importing Russian oil, arguing that it's essential for affordable energy and national interest. The Ministry of External Affairs highlighted that the US and EU are unfairly targeting India while maintaining significant trade ties with Russia themselves, including energy and critical materials. India emphasized its role in stabilizing global energy markets.
